abstracts.cdata!:
This project is rated as unsatisfactory.
            The development objectives were beyond reach largely because
            of capacity and financial management constraints not
            identified as risks in the Staff Appraisal Report (SAR)
            (Report no. 19210). The key lessons learned are similar to
            and overlap with lessons extracted in the ICR for the Third
            Population Project (Report no. 16514). They include: 1)
            weaknesses in areas of financial management and accounting,
            administrative capacity, procurement capacity, and/or
            project monitoring that should be addressed in previous
            projects before approving new projects; 2) using an
            independent procurement agent at appraisal, particularly
            when a high degree of technical expertise, comprehensive
            logistics capacity, and forecasting capacity are required;
            3) enacting measures to avoid a wasteful and inefficient use
            of scarce resources when undertaking civil works in future
            IDA-financed health sector operations; 4) not submitting
            projects for Board approval from sectors in which audits are
            overdue; not reducing the amount of financial oversight for
            countries with a history of financial management problems;
            5) making project ratings realistic and based on actual
            results; 6) maintaining donor coordination throughout
            project implementation; 7) limiting and prioritizing future
            training programs; and 8) addressing the problems that
            prevented the activities from being completed in the first place.
